en.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Swimming Training What is Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) is the theoretical maximum swimming velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. CSS is calculated using a 400m and 200m time trial to determine personalized training zones. Critical Swim Speed (CSS) represents the theoretica

en.content: Swimming Efficiency: SWOLF Your Stroke Economy Score - Lower is Better What is SWOLF? SWOLF (Swim + Golf) is a composite efficiency metric that combines stroke count and time into a single number. Like golf, the goal is to minimize your score. Formula SWOLF = Lap Time (seconds) + Stroke Count Example: If you swim 25m in 20 seconds with 15 strokes: SWOLF = 20 + 15 = 35 Normalized SWOLF for Pool Comparison To compare scores across different pool lengths: SWOLF‚ÇÇ‚ÇÖ = (Time √ó 25/Pool Length) + (Stroke

en.description: Master stroke mechanics metrics: Distance Per Stroke (DPS), Stroke Rate (SR), and Stroke Index (SI). Learn to optimize efficiency and speed with advanced swimming
en.content: Stroke Mechanics The Biomechanics of Swimming Speed The Fundamental Equation of Swimming Speed The Velocity Equation Velocity = Stroke Rate (SR) √ó Distance Per Stroke (DPS) Translation: How fast you swim depends on how often you stroke (SR) multiplied by how far you travel per stroke (DPS). This deceptively simple equation governs all swimming performance. To get faster, you must either: Increase Stroke Rate (turnover faster) while maintaining DPS Increase Distance Per Stroke (travel farther per

en.content: Free Swimming TSS Calculator Calculate Training Stress Score for swimming workouts - The only free sTSS calculator What is Swimming TSS (sTSS)? Swimming Training Stress Score (sTSS) quantifies the training load of a swimming workout by combining intensity and duration. It's adapted from cycling's TSS methodology, using your Critical Swim Speed (CSS) as the threshold pace. A 1-hour workout at CSS pace = 100 sTSS. ja.content: Ê∞¥Ê≥≥„ÅÆÂäπÁéáÊÄßÔºöSWOLF „Çπ„Éà„É≠„Éº„ÇØ„Ç®„Ç≥„Éé„Éü„Éº„Çπ„Ç≥„Ç¢ - ‰Ωé„ÅÑ„Åª„Å©ËâØ„ÅÑ SWOLF„Å®„ÅØÔºü SWOLFÔºàSwim + GolfÔºâ„ÅØ„ÄÅ„Çπ„Éà„É≠„Éº„ÇØÊï∞„Å®ÊôÇÈñì„Çí1„Å§„ÅÆÊï∞ÂÄ§„Å´ÁµÑ„ÅøÂêà„Çè„Åõ„ÅüË§áÂêàÂäπÁéá„É°„Éà„É™„ÇØ„Çπ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„Ç¥„É´„Éï„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„ÄÅ„Çπ„Ç≥„Ç¢„ÇíÊúÄÂ∞èÂåñ„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„ÅåÁõÆÊ®ô„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ Ë®àÁÆóÂºè SWOLF = „É©„ÉÉ„Éó„Çø„Ç§„É†ÔºàÁßíÔºâ+ „Çπ„Éà„É≠„Éº„ÇØÊï∞ ‰æãÔºö 25m„Çí20Áßí„ÄÅ15„Çπ„Éà„É≠„Éº„ÇØ„ÅßÊ≥≥„ÅÑ„Å†Â†¥ÂêàÔºö SWOLF = 20 + 15 = 35 „Éó„Éº„É´ÈñìÊØîËºÉ„ÅÆ„Åü„ÇÅ„ÅÆÊ≠£Ë¶èÂåñSWOLF Áï∞„Å™„Çã„Éó„Éº„É´Èï∑„ÅïÈñì„Åß„Çπ„Ç≥„Ç¢„ÇíÊØîËºÉ„Åô„Çã„Å´„ÅØÔºö SWOLF‚ÇÇ‚ÇÖ = (ÊôÇÈñì √ó 25/„Éó„Éº„É´Èï∑) + („Çπ„Éà„É≠„Éº„ÇØÊï∞ √ó 25/„Éó„Éº„É´Èï∑) SWOLFÂü∫Ê∫ñÂÄ§ Ëá™Áî±ÂΩ¢ - 25m„Éó„Éº„É´ „Ç®„É™„Éº„Éà„Çπ„Ç§„Éû„Éº 30-35 ÂõΩÂÜÖ/ÂõΩÈöõ„É¨„Éô„É´„ÄÅÂçìË∂ä„Åó„ÅüÂäπÁéáÊÄß Á´∂ÊäÄ„Çπ„Ç§„Éû„Éº 35-45 È´òÊ†°‰ª£Ë°®„É¨„Éô„É´„ÄÅÂ§ßÂ≠¶„ÄÅÁ´∂ÊäÄ„Éû„Çπ„Çø„Éº„Ç∫ „Éï„Ç£„ÉÉ„Éà„Éç„Çπ„Çπ„Ç§„Éû„Éº 45-60 ÂÆöÊúüÁöÑ„Å™„Éà„É¨„Éº„Éã„É≥„Ç∞„ÄÅ„Åó„Å£„Åã„Çä„Åó„ÅüÊäÄË°ì ÂàùÂøÉËÄÖ 60+ ÊäÄË°ì„Å®„Ç≥„É≥„Éá„Ç£„Ç∑„Éß„Éã„É≥„Ç∞„ÅÆÁô∫Â±ïÈÄî‰∏ä „Åù„ÅÆ‰ªñ„ÅÆÊ≥≥Ê≥ï - 25m„Éó„Éº„É´ ËÉåÊ≥≥„Åé ÈÄöÂ∏∏„ÄÅËá™Áî±ÂΩ¢„Çà„Çä 5-10„Éù„Ç§„É≥„ÉàÈ´ò„ÅÑ ËâØÂ•ΩÔºö40-50 Âπ≥Ê≥≥„Åé „Ç∞„É©„Ç§„ÉâÊäÄË°ì„Å´„Çà„Çä

sw.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) Msingi wa Mafunzo ya Kuogelea Yanayotegemea Data Ni nini Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) ni kasi ya juu ya nadharia ya kuogelea unayoweza kudumisha bila kuchoka. Inawakilisha kasi yako ya kizingiti cha aerobic, kwa kawaida inaoana na 4 mmol/L lactate ya damu na inayoweza kudumishwa kwa takriban dakika 30. CSS inahesabiwa kwa kutumia jaribio la muda wa 400m na 200m ili kubainisha maeneo ya kibinafsi ya mafunzo. Critical Swim Speed (CSS) inawakilisha

sw.title: Kikokotoo cha SWOLF: Pima Ufanisi wa Kuogelea | Chini ni Bora
sw.description: Kikokotoo cha SWOLF (Kuogelea + Gofu) kinapima ufanisi wa kuogelea. Kokotoa alama yako, linganisha viwango vya kiwango, na tumia mazoezi ya mafunzo kuboresha. SWOLF ya
sw.content: Ufanisi wa Kuogelea: SWOLF Alama Yako ya Uchumi wa Mvuto - Chini ni Bora SWOLF ni Nini? SWOLF (Swim + Golf) ni kipimo cha ufanisi cha muundo ambayo kinaunganisha hesabu ya mvuto na muda katika nambari moja. Kama gofu, lengo ni kupunguza alama yako. Fomula SWOLF = Lap Time (seconds) + Stroke Count Mfano: Ikiwa unaogelea 25m kwa sekunde 20 na mikwaju 15: SWOLF = 20 + 15 = 35 SWOLF Iliyosawazishwa kwa Ulinganisho wa Bwawa Kulinganisha alama katika urefu tofauti wa bwawa: SWOLF‚ÇÇ‚ÇÖ = (Time √ó 25/Pool L

kn.content: Swim Analytics vs Other Swimming Apps - Feature Comparison How Swim Analytics compares to Strava, TrainingPeaks, Final Surge, and other swim tracking platforms Why Swimming Needs Specialized Analytics General fitness apps like Strava and TrainingPeaks excel at cycling and running, but swimming requires different metrics . Critical Swim Speed (CSS), pace-based training zones, and stroke mechanics aren't properly supported in multi-sport platforms. Swim Analytics is built specifically for swimming

kn.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Swimming Training What is Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) is the theoretical maximum swimming velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. kn.content: Swimming Efficiency: SWOLF Your Stroke Economy Score - Lower is Better What is SWOLF? SWOLF (Swim + Golf) is a composite efficiency metric that combines stroke count and time into a single number. Like golf, the goal is to minimize your score. kn.content: Stroke Mechanics The Biomechanics of Swimming Speed The Fundamental Equation of Swimming Speed The Velocity Equation Velocity = Stroke Rate (SR) √ó Distance Per Stroke (DPS) Translation: How fast you swim depends on how often you stroke (SR) multiplied by how far you travel per stroke (DPS). This deceptively simple equation governs all swimming performance. kn.content: Free Swimming TSS Calculator Calculate Training Stress Score for swimming workouts - The only free sTSS calculator What is Swimming TSS (sTSS)? Swimming Training Stress Score (sTSS) quantifies the training load of a swimming workout by combining intensity and duration. It's adapted from cycling's TSS methodology, using your Critical Swim Speed (CSS) as the threshold pace. A 1-hour workout at CSS pace = 100 sTSS. Not just distance or time, but the true physiological stress imposed on your body. et.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Swimming Training What is Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) is the theoretical maximum swimming velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. CSS is calculated using a 400m and 200m time trial to determine personalized training zones. Critical Swim Speed (CSS) represents the theoretica

et.content: Swimming Efficiency: SWOLF Your Stroke Economy Score - Lower is Better What is SWOLF? SWOLF (Swim + Golf) is a composite efficiency metric that combines stroke count and time into a single number. Like golf, the goal is to minimize your score. Formula SWOLF = Lap Time (seconds) + Stroke Count Example: If you swim 25m in 20 seconds with 15 strokes: SWOLF = 20 + 15 = 35 Normalized SWOLF for Pool Comparison To compare scores across different pool lengths: SWOLF‚ÇÇ‚ÇÖ = (Time √ó 25/Pool Length) + (Stroke

et.content: Stroke Mechanics The Biomechanics of Swimming Speed The Fundamental Equation of Swimming Speed The Velocity Equation Velocity = Stroke Rate (SR) √ó Distance Per Stroke (DPS) Translation: How fast you swim depends on how often you stroke (SR) multiplied by how far you travel per stroke (DPS). This deceptively simple equation governs all swimming performance. et.content: Free Swimming TSS Calculator Calculate Training Stress Score for swimming workouts - The only free sTSS calculator What is Swimming TSS (sTSS)? Swimming Training Stress Score (sTSS) quantifies the training load of a swimming workout by combining intensity and duration. It's adapted from cycling's TSS methodology, using your Critical Swim Speed (CSS) as the threshold pace. A 1-hour workout at CSS pace = 100 sTSS. et.content: Training Load & Performance Management Quantifying Stress, Tracking Fitness, Optimizing Performance Understanding Training Load Training load quantification answers the critical question: How hard was that workout? Not just distance or time, but the true physiological stress imposed on your body. fa.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Swimming Training What is Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) is the theoretical maximum swimming velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. CSS is calculated using a 400m and 200m time trial to determine personalized training zones. Critical Swim Speed (CSS) represents the theoretica

fa.content: Swimming Efficiency: SWOLF Your Stroke Economy Score - Lower is Better What is SWOLF? SWOLF (Swim + Golf) is a composite efficiency metric that combines stroke count and time into a single number. Like golf, the goal is to minimize your score. fi.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Swimming Training What is Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) is the theoretical maximum swimming velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. CSS is calculated using a 400m and 200m time trial to determine personalized training zones. Critical Swim Speed (CSS) represents the theoretica

fi.content: Swimming Efficiency: SWOLF Your Stroke Economy Score - Lower is Better What is SWOLF? SWOLF (Swim + Golf) is a composite efficiency metric that combines stroke count and time into a single number. Like golf, the goal is to minimize your score. he.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Swimming Training What is Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) is the theoretical maximum swimming velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. id.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Swimming Training What is Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) is the theoretical maximum swimming velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. CSS is calculated using a 400m and 200m time trial to determine personalized training zones. Critical Swim Speed (CSS) represents the theoretica

id.content: Swimming Efficiency: SWOLF Your Stroke Economy Score - Lower is Better What is SWOLF? SWOLF (Swim + Golf) is a composite efficiency metric that combines stroke count and time into a single number. Like golf, the goal is to minimize your score. Formula SWOLF = Lap Time (seconds) + Stroke Count Example: If you swim 25m in 20 seconds with 15 strokes: SWOLF = 20 + 15 = 35 Normalized SWOLF for Pool Comparison To compare scores across different pool lengths: SWOLF‚ÇÇ‚ÇÖ = (Time √ó 25/Pool Length) + (Stroke

Swimming Training Stress Score (sTSS) quantifies the training load of a swimming workout by combining intensity and duration. It's adapted from cycling's TSS methodology, using your Critical Swim Speed (CSS) as the threshold pace. A 1-hour workout at CSS pace = 100 sTSS. lv.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Swimming Training What is Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) is the theoretical maximum swimming velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. my.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Swimming Training What is Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) is the theoretical maximum swimming velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. sk.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Swimming Training What is Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) is the theoretical maximum swimming velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. CSS is calculated using a 400m and 200m time trial to determine personalized training zones. Critical Swim Speed (CSS) represents the theoretica

sk.content: Swimming Efficiency: SWOLF Your Stroke Economy Score - Lower is Better What is SWOLF? SWOLF (Swim + Golf) is a composite efficiency metric that combines stroke count and time into a single number. Like golf, the goal is to minimize your score. sr.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Swimming Training What is Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) is the theoretical maximum swimming velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. tl.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Swimming Training What is Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) is the theoretical maximum swimming velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. CSS is calculated using a 400m and 200m time trial to determine personalized training zones. Critical Swim Speed (CSS) represents the theoretica

tl.content: Swimming Efficiency: SWOLF Your Stroke Economy Score - Lower is Better What is SWOLF? uk.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Swimming Training What is Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) is the theoretical maximum swimming velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. CSS is calculated using a 400m and 200m time trial to determine personalized training zones. Critical Swim Speed (CSS) represents the theoretica

uk.content: Swimming Efficiency: SWOLF Your Stroke Economy Score - Lower is Better What is SWOLF? SWOLF (Swim + Golf) is a composite efficiency metric that combines stroke count and time into a single number. Like golf, the goal is to minimize your score. uk.content: Free Swimming TSS Calculator Calculate Training Stress Score for swimming workouts - The only free sTSS calculator What is Swimming TSS (sTSS)? Swimming Training Stress Score (sTSS) quantifies the training load of a swimming workout by combining intensity and duration. It's adapted from cycling's TSS methodology, using your Critical Swim Speed (CSS) as the threshold pace. A 1-hour workout at CSS pace = 100 sTSS. uk.content: Training Load & Performance Management Quantifying Stress, Tracking Fitness, Optimizing Performance Understanding Training Load Training load quantification answers the critical question: How hard was that workout? Not just distance or time, but the true physiological stress imposed on your body. vi.content: Critical Swim Speed (CSS) The Foundation of Data-Driven Swimming Training What is Critical Swim Speed (CSS)? Critical Swim Speed (CSS) is the theoretical maximum swimming velocity you can maintain without exhaustion. It represents your aerobic threshold pace, typically corresponding to 4 mmol/L blood lactate and sustainable for approximately 30 minutes. CSS is calculated using a 400m and 200m time trial to determine personalized training zones. Critical Swim Speed (CSS) represents the theoretica

vi.content: Swimming Efficiency: SWOLF Your Stroke Economy Score - Lower is Better What is SWOLF? SWOLF (Swim + Golf) is a composite efficiency metric that combines stroke count and time into a single number. Like golf, the goal is to minimize your score. vi.content: Stroke Mechanics The Biomechanics of Swimming Speed The Fundamental Equation of Swimming Speed The Velocity Equation Velocity = Stroke Rate (SR) √ó Distance Per Stroke (DPS) Translation: How fast you swim depends on how often you stroke (SR) multiplied by how far you travel per stroke (DPS). This deceptively simple equation governs all swimming performance. vi.content: Free Swimming TSS Calculator Calculate Training Stress Score for swimming workouts - The only free sTSS calculator What is Swimming TSS (sTSS)? Swimming Training Stress Score (sTSS) quantifies the training load of a swimming workout by combining intensity and duration. It's adapted from cycling's TSS methodology, using your Critical Swim Speed (CSS) as the threshold pace. A 1-hour workout at CSS pace = 100 sTSS.
